page.title: 03LLANYBRI VILLAGE
page.content: Llanybri village stands on a hill behind Llansteffan and is smaller and more rural in character. In the middle stands the roofles shell of Hen Gapel (Old Chapel). The 36 village houses are nearly all over 100 years old, except for a few modern bungalows. There is also a council estate on the edge of the village, with 12 houses and 14 old people's bungalows (with resident warden). Unlike Llansteffan, where the farmhouses stand in the midst of the holdings and are away from the village, Llanybri has 4 farmhouses with their yards and buildings on the roadside, giving it an air of rural busyness absent from Llansteffan. In recent years, Local Authority grants have enabled owners to improve their old houses, so that now virtually all have indoor sanitation with baths or showers.
